verses.plain: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

tokens.t: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he
righteous in his own eyes.

verses.plain: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

tokens.t: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

verses.plain: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

tokens.t: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and
had condemned Job.

verses.plain: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

tokens.t: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they
elder than he.

verses.plain: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

tokens.t: When Elihu saw that
no answer in the mouth of
three men, then his wrath was kindled.

verses.plain: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

tokens.t: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I
young, and ye
very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

verses.plain: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

tokens.t: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

verses.plain: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

tokens.t: But
a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

verses.plain: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

tokens.t: Great men are not
wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

verses.plain: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

tokens.t: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

verses.plain: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

tokens.t: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

verses.plain: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

tokens.t: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold,
none of you that convinced Job,
that answered his words:

verses.plain: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

tokens.t: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

verses.plain: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

tokens.t: Now he hath not directed
words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

verses.plain: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

tokens.t: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

verses.plain: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

tokens.t: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still,
answered no more;)

verses.plain: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

tokens.t: , I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

verses.plain: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

tokens.t: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

verses.plain: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

tokens.t: Behold, my belly
as wine
hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

verses.plain: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

tokens.t: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

verses.plain: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

tokens.t: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man’s person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

verses.plain: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.

tokens.t: For I know not to give flattering titles;
my maker would soon take me away.

footnotes.text: waited…: Heb. expected Job in words
left…: Heb. removed speeches from themselves
spirit…: Heb. spirit of my belly
